oai_dc:dc.dc:title: John Coffee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Coffee (1772-1833) photograph of an engraved portrait. Portrait from the shoulder up. He wears a dark vest and suit with a light shirt and necktie. Hair curls just over the collar of his coat. Some writing cut off at the bottom of the portrait.

Tennessee soldier and surveyor. Coffee was a brigadier-general during the War of 1812, serving alongside his close friend, Andrew Jackson. He later moved to Alabama where he became a wealthy land owner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Coffee, John, 1772-1833
Coffee, John, 1772-1833;Creek War, 1813-1814;United States. Indian Removal Act of 1830
Military officers;Surveyors
